metadata.Title: CVE-2023-39194 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the XFRM subsystem in the Linux kernel. The specificflaw exists within the processing of state filters, which can result in aread past the end of an allocated buffer. This flaw allows a localprivileged (CAP_NET_ADMIN) attacker to trigger an out-of-bounds read,potentially leading to an information disclosure.

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-kvm package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life').
linux-aws package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-azure package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-lowlatency package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-oracle package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
linux-starfive package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
